description: This notification type is used by agent to emit traps if
(1). The event should be generated by timePictra system.
(2). The event severity should be either major,minor or
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD NOTIFY-MIB::systemAlarm NOTIFY-MIB::eventNeId i 9999 NOTIFY-MIB::eventId i 9999 NOTIFY-MIB::eventNeClli s EXAMPLE NOTIFY-MIB::eventNeAddress s EXAMPLE NOTIFY-MIB::eventAid s EXAMPLE NOTIFY-MIB::eventPort s EXAMPLE NOTIFY-MIB::trapSeverity i 3 NOTIFY-MIB::eventNature i 0 NOTIFY-MIB::conditionType s EXAMPLE NOTIFY-MIB::message s softwareError NOTIFY-MIB::timeStamp s EXAMPLE NOTIFY-MIB::probableCause i 46 NOTIFY-MIB::alarmEventType i 1 NOTIFY-MIB::additionalText s EXAMPLE

description: This attribute gives the network element's unique Id in
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::eventNeId

description: This attribute gives the unique event identifier in the
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::eventId

description: This attribute gives the selection name of the NE
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::eventNeClli

description: This attribute gives the ipaddress of Network element.
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::eventNeAddress

description: This attribute gives the access identifier of the network
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::eventAid

description: This attribute gives info about the port number
through which the communication with NE is done
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::eventPort

description: This attribute gives the severity information about the
event.The mapping in the database as follows:
and by default the agent will follow the same pattern.But
the manager is allowed to change this mapping by propriately
setting the value of 'trapToSeverityMap' attribute. For
example, let us say TimePictra reports severity as 2 for
minor,3 for major and 4 for critical and manager want to
see 1 for critical,2 for major and 3 for minor. Then the
Any severity which is not present will be send as 0(ie
Agent will only send the integer values.The interpretation
of these values is left to the manager
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::trapSeverity

description: This attribute gives the nature of an event.
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::eventNature

description: This attribute gives the information about the event
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::conditionType

description: This attribute gives the description of an event.
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::message

description: This attribute gives the time of occurence of the event.
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::timeStamp

description: This attribute gives the information about the cause of
event.Some of the possible values of probable cause could be
The default value for eventProbableCauseMap is 64.
This default value can be changed and MUST be present
in the SNMP Agent configuration file snmp_ctree.cnf.
Customers can configure this as per they want or just
An example of a different configuration could be :
in the SNMP trap notification for condtype
(name of alarm) INDISQ, probableCause attribute would be 34.
in the SNMP trap notification for condtype (name of alarm)
in the SNMP trap notification for condtype (name of alarm)
and for ALL the REST of SNMP trap notifications, probableCause
Important note: above is just an example for explanation purposes,
it is NOT the current value of eventProbableCauseMap.
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::probableCause

description: This attribute gives the information about the category
of event.Some of the possible values of alarmEventType could be
The manager is open to decide upon value this variable for different
condition types by appropriately setting value of
For example, lets say there are three reported condition types
The actual number will be much more) which are INDISQ,OPCDNA
and INPLOSS.If the manager wants alarmEventType 4 for INDISQ,
2 for OPCDNA and 0 for INPLOSS, then the map will be
Agent will only send the integer values.The interpretation
of these values is left to the manager
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::alarmEventType

description: This attribute is meant to provide additional information
variables.name: NOTIFY-MIB::additionalText
